gui

Class Boundary

  • java.lang.Object
    • gui.Boundary

  • public class Boundary
extends java.lang.Object
    Boundaries are rectangular shapes, ellipses and actual rectangles drawn on the screen when the user is setting up their chamber configuration. They first draw a rectangle for the chamber and then add ellipses and recntagles inside it as obstructions

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      boolean isResizing
      True if the Boundary is being resized, in which case its edge is thickened slightly.
      Feature rectangle
      True if the shape is a rectangle, false if its an ellipse
      java.awt.geom.RectangularShape shape 

    • Constructor Summary

    • Field Detail

      • shape

        public java.awt.geom.RectangularShape shape

      • rectangle

        public Feature rectangle
        True if the shape is a rectangle, false if its an ellipse

      • isResizing

        public boolean isResizing
        True if the Boundary is being resized, in which case its edge is thickened slightly. (also thinkens if the mouse hovers over the edge).

    • Constructor Detail

      • Boundary

        public Boundary(Feature rect,
                float x,
                float y,
                float width,
                float height)
        Create an Boundary marking a specific rectangular spot on an image.
        Parameters:
        rect - the boundary is a rectangle or else an ellipse, and either a wall, sink or source
        x - initial x coordinate (left-most x coordinate)
        y - initial y coordinate (top-most y coordinate)
        width - width of this Boundary
        height - height of this Boundary

    • Method Detail

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Generate a String in the form f{[x,y;w,h] i[x',y';w',h']...}, if sub-Boundarys are included; otherwise, generate f[x,y;w,h].
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • contains

        public boolean contains(java.awt.geom.Point2D.Float p)
        Confirms if point p is within this Boundary, check takes into account whether or not the Boundary is an ellipse or a rectangle
        Parameters:
        p - the point to check
        Returns:
        true if the point is inside or on the rectangle, else false;

      • getArea

        public float getArea()
        Returns:
        the area this Boundary covers in pixels^2.

      • getAspectRatio

        public float getAspectRatio()
        Returns:
        the lowest aspect ratio this Boundary could have regardless of orientation.

      • withinBufferRange

        public boolean withinBufferRange(java.awt.geom.Point2D.Float pt)
        Confirm if a point is within margins for grabbing the boarder and resizing it
        Parameters:
        pt - the point to check
        buffer - distance from the boarder the pt can be and still return true
        Returns:
        true if the pt is within the buffer's distance from the boarder

      • getStart

        public java.awt.geom.Point2D.Float getStart()
        Returns:
        the start point of this Boundary relative to its image origin

      • getEnd

        public java.awt.geom.Point2D.Float getEnd()
        Returns:
        the end point of this Boundary relative to its image origin

      • setRect

        public void setRect(java.awt.geom.Point2D.Float pt1,
                    java.awt.geom.Point2D.Float pt2)
        sets the Boundary's boundaries based on the two given points, with the confine that the Boundary cannot leave its parent if a parent exists
        Parameters:
        pt1 - one point to define the rectangle
        pt2 - another point to define the rectangle

      • getBoundaryAtPoint

        public static Boundary getBoundaryAtPoint(java.awt.geom.Point2D.Float pt,
                                          java.util.ArrayList<Boundary> list)
        Iterate through the list of boundaries and return the first boundary found that contains the given point
        Parameters:
        pt - the point to search for boundaries at
        list - the list of boundaries to search for the point in.
        Returns:
        the first Boundary that contains the point (or null if none exist)

      • translate

        public void translate(java.awt.geom.Point2D.Float dist)
        Translate the Boundary a distance indicated by the given point
        Parameters:
        dist - more a vector than an actual point this tells how far in the x and y direction to move this Boundary
        frame - boundary that Boundary can't be translated outside of

      • lowerLeft

        public java.awt.geom.Point2D.Float lowerLeft()
        Returns:
        the lower left corner of the rectangle

      • upperRight

        public java.awt.geom.Point2D.Float upperRight()
        Returns:
        the upper right corner of the rectangle

      • getCorners

        public java.awt.geom.Point2D.Float[] getCorners()
        Returns:
        the four corners of the rectangle in the order: upper left, upper right, lower left, lower right

      • removeBoundaryAtPoint

        public static void removeBoundaryAtPoint(java.awt.geom.Point2D.Float pt,
                                         java.util.ArrayList<Boundary> list)
        remove the first boundary at the given point

      • nearBoundary

        public static Boundary nearBoundary(java.awt.geom.Point2D.Float pt,
                                    java.util.ArrayList<Boundary> list)
        Return the first Boundary near the given point
        Parameters:
        pt - point to search for boundaries near
        list - the list of boundaries to search for Boundaries in
        Returns:
        the first Boundary near the given point (near is within MARGIN of the point).

      • setFeature

        public void setFeature(Feature f)
        Set the given feature and shift from Rectangle to Ellipse or vice versa
        Parameters:
        f - the feature to shift the Boundary to
